intro: Cupania triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed cupania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets, and its small, inconspicuous flowers. Cupania triloba produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
